page.title: 16REMINISCENCES
page.content: Different but not better is the opinion of people who have spent most of their lives in the area. Gone are all but one of the eight brickworks which now makes tiles.The station which employed over 80 people is an unmanned open station.Shops are more numerous but shops eg. WH Smith are gone.People are less friendly and have less to do with each other.The maternity hospital has closed as has the Ruabon Parish Hall,once a thriving cinema and theatre.The dual carriageway in the middle of Ruabon was built in the 1930's.The church corner was improved in the 1960's and a garden of rest made for the graves. A few of the chapels have closed.Small industrial estates have been built, new houses at Vicarage Fields after 1946 and Pont Adam after 1966.The medical centre dates from 1984.
